s.text: Microsoft's chief technical officer (and Slate contributor), Nathan Myhrvold, whose "Save the Web" memo last year helped start the archive movement, counters that we don't know now what will be important later.

Microsoft's chief technical officer (and Slate contributor), Nathan Myhrvold, whose "Save the Web" memo last year helped start the archive movement, counters that we don't know now what will be important later.
When each cassette is full, a robotic arm removes it, stores it in a carousel, and replaces it with a blank one.
